A **gnome mummy**, M, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a mummified [gnome](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster_attribute\) "Gnome (monster attribute)") that is often among the first [mummies](/wiki/Mummies "Mummies") [you](/wiki/You "You") will encounter.

A gnome mummy has a single claw attack.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 History](#History)

- [3 Variants](#Variants)

  - [3.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [3.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [3.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [3.4 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [3.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [3.6 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly-generated gnome mummies are always hostile.

Gnome mummies have a 6⁄7 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a [mummy wrapping](/wiki/Mummy_wrapping "Mummy wrapping").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Gnome mummies may appear among the mummies that are part of the second quest monster class for [Archeologists](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist") and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [Archeologist quest](/wiki/Archeologist_quest "Archeologist quest").

A gnome mummy leaves behind an aged [gnome](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster\) "Gnome (monster)") [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") upon death.[\[2\]](#cite_note-undead_to_corpse-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-make_corpse-3)

## History

The gnome mummy first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), where most of the various mummies are introduced.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), gnomish and dwarvish characters will encounter gnome mummies in place of the normally peaceful gnome lords that generate in the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines") at level creation.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

Gnome mummies may appear among the mummies that are part of the first quest monster class for [Undead Slayers](/wiki/Undead_Slayer "Undead Slayer") and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [Undead Slayer quest](/wiki/Undead_Slayer_quest "Undead Slayer quest").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), gnome mummies are stronger and can inflict [mummy curses](/wiki/Mummy_curse "Mummy curse") on whoever kills them.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), gnome mummies can inflict [withering](/wiki/Withering "Withering") with their melee attacks.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), gnome mummies can inflict [withering](/wiki/Withering "Withering") with their melee attacks.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), gnome mummies can inflict withering with their melee attacks.

### Hack'EM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, gnome mummies in [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") can also inflict withering with their melee attacks as in EvilHack.

## Encyclopedia entry

But for an account of the manner in which the body was  
bandaged, and a list of the unguents and other materials  
employed in the process, and the words of power which were  
spoken as each bandage was laid in its place, we must have  
recourse to a very interesting papyrus which has been edited  
and translated by M. Maspero under the title of Le Rituel de  
l'Embaumement. ...  
Everything that could be done to preserve the body was now  
done, and every member of it was, by means of the words of  
power which changed perishable substances into imperishable,  
protected to all eternity; when the final covering of purple  
or white linen had been fastened upon it, the body was ready  
for the tomb.

\[ Egyptian Magic, by E.A. Wallis Budge ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 740](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L740)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-undead_to_corpse_2-0) [src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 147](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mon.c#L147): *Converting monster index of undead to corpses of their living counterparts*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-make_corpse_3-0) [src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 372](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mon.c#L372): *Undead corpses and their ages are handled with other "special" death drops*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [sp\_lev.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 854](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/sp_lev.c#line854 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/sp lev.c")

Gnome mummy

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
M gnome mummy
Difficulty 5
Attacks Claw 1d6
M gnome mummy
Difficulty 5
Attacks

Claw 1d6

Base level 4
Base experience 41
Speed 10
Base AC 6
Base MR 20
Alignment −3 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 650
Nutritional value 50
Size Small
Resistances Cold, Sleep, Poison
Resistances conveyed None

A gnome mummy:

  • does not breathe.
  • is mindless.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is undead.
  • is a gnome.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • has infravision.
  • can leave an old gnome corpse.
Reference monst.c#line1672

A gnome mummy, M, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. It is a mummified gnome that is often among the first mummies you will encounter.

A gnome mummy has a single claw attack.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 History
  • 3 Variants
    • 3.1 SLASH'EM
    • 3.2 dNetHack
    • 3.3 xNetHack
    • 3.4 SpliceHack
    • 3.5 EvilHack
    • 3.6 Hack'EM
  • 4 Encyclopedia entry
  • 5 References

Generation

Randomly-generated gnome mummies are always hostile.

Gnome mummies have a 6⁄7 chance of being generated with a mummy wrapping.[1]

Gnome mummies may appear among the mummies that are part of the second quest monster class for Archeologists and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the Archeologist quest.

A gnome mummy leaves behind an aged gnome corpse upon death.[2][3]

History

The gnome mummy first appears in NetHack 3.0.0, where most of the various mummies are introduced.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, gnomish and dwarvish characters will encounter gnome mummies in place of the normally peaceful gnome lords that generate in the Gnomish Mines at level creation.[4]

Gnome mummies may appear among the mummies that are part of the first quest monster class for Undead Slayers and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the Undead Slayer quest.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, gnome mummies are stronger and can inflict mummy curses on whoever kills them.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, gnome mummies can inflict withering with their melee attacks.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, gnome mummies can inflict withering with their melee attacks.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, gnome mummies can inflict withering with their melee attacks.

Hack'EM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, gnome mummies in Hack'EM can also inflict withering with their melee attacks as in EvilHack.

Encyclopedia entry

But for an account of the manner in which the body was
bandaged, and a list of the unguents and other materials
employed in the process, and the words of power which were
spoken as each bandage was laid in its place, we must have
recourse to a very interesting papyrus which has been edited
and translated by M. Maspero under the title of Le Rituel de
l'Embaumement. ...
Everything that could be done to preserve the body was now
done, and every member of it was, by means of the words of
power which changed perishable substances into imperishable,
protected to all eternity; when the final covering of purple
or white linen had been fastened upon it, the body was ready
for the tomb.

[ Egyptian Magic, by E.A. Wallis Budge ]

References

  1. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 740
  2. ↑ src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 147: Converting monster index of undead to corpses of their living counterparts
  3. ↑ src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 372: Undead corpses and their ages are handled with other "special" death drops
  4. ↑ sp_lev.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 854

A '''gnome mummy''', {{monsym|gnome mummy}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is a mummified [[Gnome (monster attribute)|gnome]] that is often among the first [[mummies]] [[you]] will encounter.

A gnome mummy has a single claw attack.

==Generation==
Randomly-generated gnome mummies are always hostile.

Gnome mummies have a {{frac|6|7}} chance of [[Monster starting inventory|being generated with]] a [[mummy wrapping]].{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|740|nethack=3.6.7}}

Gnome mummies may appear among the mummies that are part of the second quest monster class for [[Archeologist]]s and make up {{frac|6|175}} of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [[Archeologist quest]].

A gnome mummy leaves behind an aged [[Gnome (monster)|gnome]] [[corpse]] upon death.{{refsrc|src/mon.c|147|nethack=3.6.7|name="undead_to_corpse"|comment=Converting monster index of undead to corpses of their living counterparts}}{{refsrc|src/mon.c|372|nethack=3.6.7|name="make_corpse"|comment=Undead corpses and their ages are handled with other "special" death drops}}

==History==
The gnome mummy first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]], where most of the various mummies are introduced.

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], gnomish and dwarvish characters will encounter gnome mummies in place of the normally peaceful gnome lords that generate in the [[Gnomish Mines]] at level creation.{{refsrc|sp_lev.c|854|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

Gnome mummies may appear among the mummies that are part of the first quest monster class for [[Undead Slayer]]s and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [[Undead Slayer quest]].

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], gnome mummies are stronger and can inflict [[mummy curse]]s on whoever kills them.

===xNetHack===
In [[xNetHack]], gnome mummies can inflict [[withering]] with their melee attacks.

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], gnome mummies can inflict [[withering]] with their melee attacks.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], gnome mummies can inflict withering with their melee attacks.

===Hack'EM===
In addition to SLASH'EM details, gnome mummies in [[Hack'EM]] can also inflict withering with their melee attacks as in EvilHack.

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|
But for an account of the manner in which the body was
bandaged, and a list of the unguents and other materials
employed in the process, and the words of power which were
spoken as each bandage was laid in its place, we must have
recourse to a very interesting papyrus which has been edited
and translated by M. Maspero under the title of Le Rituel de
l'Embaumement. ...
Everything that could be done to preserve the body was now
done, and every member of it was, by means of the words of
power which changed perishable substances into imperishable,
protected to all eternity; when the final covering of purple
or white linen had been fastened upon it, the body was ready
for the tomb.
|[ Egyptian Magic, by E.A. Wallis Budge ]
}}
